title: Vancouver Whitecaps attacker Yordy Reyna out until summer after foot surgery
text:
Vancouver Whitecaps attacker Yordy Reyna out until summer after foot surgery Getty Images Feb 21, 2017 11:05:31 PM The Peru international will have to wait several months to make his Vancouver debut. 
The Vancouver Whitecaps announced Tuesday that midfielder-forward Yordy Reyna has undergone surgery for a fifth metatarsal fracture of his left foot. 
Reyna, who was signed from Red Bull Salzburg in the offseason, suffered the injury in a friendly against the Portland Timbers on Feb. 15. He will now be sidelined until at least early summer. 
D.C. United signs Mullins to extension 
“Yordy was only with the group for a few weeks before his unfortunate injury but quickly showed his attacking quality and dynamic play,” Whitecaps head coach Carl Robinson said in a news release. “We’re happy to hear the surgery went well and anticipate he will be back to full training at the start of summer." 
Reyna, 23, has been capped 17 times by Peru, scoring two goals. Related
